body:
As a user I want to have microarchitecture specific flags injected for LLVM compilers so that I would compile by default code that is optimized for the target of the installation.

### Rationale

We already support this feature for GCC since #3206 and need to extend the capability to other compilers as well

### Description
What needs to be done is carefully reviewing docs and man pages, and encode in [this file](https://github.com/spack/spack/blob/develop/lib/spack/llnl/util/cpu/microarchitectures.json) the information found.



### Additional information
A non exhaustive list of pages we might want to consult:
- Docs linked in the official [Download page](https://releases.llvm.org/download.html)

We also need to check what will be the Fortran support for clang and if `flang` is compatible with all of the `-march` flags.
title: Add microarchitecture specific flags for LLVM compilers
